instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message:
Hi guys, sorry about my English. This is an 820-3476A that arrived without power on.
The SMC looks reflowed and liquid damage around u7200.
I change u7200 and now the board turn on but not fan spin, no chime, and no usb activity.
I try a good efi bios and still no brain

PPVCC_S0_CPU.        1.74v
PP3V3_S0                   3.3v
PP1V05_S0                 1.05v
PP0V675_S0_DDRVTT   0.675v
PP3V3_S0                        3.3v
PLT_RESET_L                     0v
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK     0v

Diode mode
PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1 0.045v
PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH2 0.045v

Resistence
PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1 40ohm
PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH2 40ohm

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message: Remove U1950 and inspect its pads...

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply
The pad on u1950 are good and just in case change the chip and still the same

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Mac Tech, post: 88899, member: 34050"]
U1950 receive SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD?
[/QUOTE]

No
SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD 0v

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message: here may be the problem, this signal is generated by U5000 SMC. But some transistor may be blocking the signal. If I already change u1950.

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Mac Tech, post: 88901, member: 34050"]
here may be the problem, this signal is generated by U5000 SMC. But some transistor may be blocking the signal. If I already change u1950.
[/QUOTE]
I suspect that the smc could cause the trouble because it was reflowed previusly. 
Need a donor for this SMC. Soon update with the result. Thanks for the help

threads.title: 820-3476A NO BRAIN
threads.message:
Try reballing original SMC first.

If you get 3V at pin 6 of U1950, tie together pins 5/6 and test again the board.
